page.title: 16Buildings and materials
page.content: Of the 101 buildings in Shutford, 70% are made of stone, 21% of brick and 90% are a mixture of both. 71% have tiled rooves, 9% thatched and 20% slate. Shutford has one new development, 41 houses, not all yet completed. 63% of houses are less than 20 years old. 16% are more than 300 years old. Over 70% of families have lived in the village for less than 10 years. 28% moved into a newly built house. Only 9% of houses are family houses ie a previous generation occupied the same house. 33% of the families had relatives living in the village. Over half the houses are detached, the rest are equally semi-detached and terraced. 85% of families own their own homes.
